avalancheActivity.highlights: Some new snow on top of older windslabs and firn. New windslabs possible at highest mountains. Thin snowcower and risk of slip and slide falls.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Some new snow on top of older windslabs and firn. New windslabs possible at highest mountains. Thin snowcower and risk of slip and slide falls.

travelAdvisory.comment: NE snowfall has been ongoing widely around the country last weeks and wind slabs have grown. Human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East.

weatherForecast.highlights: Norðan átt og þurrt og fremur milt en gæti skafið í suðlæg viðhorf í hæstu fjöllum. SA-A átt um helgina með rigningu en snjókomu til fjalla

avalancheActivity.comment: Couple of small avalanches in Kirkjubólshlíð, NW-aspect, fell this week. A small slab avalanche also fell from Skollahvilft above Flateyri.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs have formed in N-NE snowdrift. Weak layers exist in the snowpack, even though most places they don´t seem very touchy. New snow is expected on Sunday.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow has been added in three storms, in mid March, during Easter and after last weekend. Snowdrift has been ongoing in N and NE winds. There has not been any thaw, so thick wind slabs have formed in gullies and leesides of mountains. They are considered rather stable in most places, but if avalanches would release they might become large. People travelling in steep slopes and gullies might trigger avalanches, especially where the weaknesses are shallow, i.e. in convex landscape features and around cliffs or rocks.

travelAdvisory.comment: NE snowfall has been ongoing widely around the country last weeks and wind slabs have grown. Human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East.
travelAdvisory.highlights: NE snowfall has been ongoing widely around the country last weeks and wind slabs have grown. Human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hægar S-SV áttir á laugardag en snjókoma aðfaranótt sunnudags. Snjóar í logni allan sunnudag en hvessir síðar í NA áttum eftir helgi.

avalancheActivity.comment: Natural avalanche cycle size 2-2,5 in SE-SW aspect on april 7th and 8th. 10. April: Skier triggered slab (Sixe: 2, elev: 600 m, aspect: SSE) in Bæjarfjall. 9.April Skier triggered slab (Sixe: 2.5, elev: 600 m, aspect: S) in Bæjarfjall. Many human triggered avalanches were released the days after the Easter-snowstorm and many big natural slab avalanches occured during the snowstorm. A rather large avalanche released in Héðinsfjarðardalur on March 26th, likely triggered by snowmobiles with remote triggering indicates a pwl
avalancheActivity.highlights: Natural avalanche cycle size 2-2,5 in SE-SW aspect on april 7th and 8th. Skier triggered slabs 9th and 10th of april. Persistant weaklayer still present in snowpits. Widespread layered windslabs on most aspects after repeated storm cycles with heavy snow accumulation some places.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The third NE-snowstorm last Sunday-Monday were adding to present windslabs which started to form the week before Easter. Snowpits near Siglufjörður show thin windslab on top of thick old windslab and a weakness within the new windslab in on snowpit. Snowpits near Dalvík showed rather stable snow but still some small slabs have released in the area today and yesterday. Persistant weakness is likely still present on the border between the windslabs and the firn below, deep in the snowpack. Therefore a risk for big avalanches from that layer if triggered.

travelAdvisory.comment: NE snowfall has been ongoing widely around the country last weeks and wind slabs have grown. Human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East.
travelAdvisory.highlights: NE snowfall has been ongoing widely around the country last weeks and wind slabs have grown. Human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæg breytileg átt á miðvikudag en vaxandi austanátt með snjókomu og skafrennigi til fjalla á fimmtudag. Stíf NA-átt og él eða samfeld snjókoma á föstudag. Hægbreytileg átt og þurrt á laugardag

avalancheActivity.comment: Few small avalanches have been seen around the area after this weeks snowfall. On the 7th of April, a rather large slab avalanche released in Harðskafi above Eskifjörður during a NE storm. Wide slab also released in the northern part of Mjóifjörður.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Considerable amount of new snow remains high in the mountains and inland after a NE snowstorm during the weekend followed by additional snowfall on Thursday. Weaknesses can be expected between wind slabs of different hardness.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Recent NE storms deposited additional snow atop already existing wind slabs formed during Easter. This has led to significant accumulation, particularly in the leeward sides of mountains and in gullies and depressions, especially above 400-500 meters altitude. Weak points have been identified between layers of wind slabs, particularly where there are differences in snow hardness. Additionally, deep presistent weakness has been identified in older snow at higher elevations. While natural avalanches are unlikely, individuals traversing steep slopes and gullies should be cautious as they could trigger an avalanche.

travelAdvisory.comment: NE snowfall has been ongoing widely around the country last weeks and wind slabs have grown. Human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East.
travelAdvisory.highlights: NE snowfall has been ongoing widely around the country last weeks and wind slabs have grown. Human triggered avalanches are considered likely, especially in the North and East.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæglætis veður næstu daga en líkur á úrkomuskoti í austan áttum seint á Sunnudag.
